column4: Hi all, trying to get a pcmcia wireless card working, lshw calls it a Texas Instruments ACX 111, the wiki says these should work out of the box. I can see and acticvate the card, but it sees no networks
did you tell it the name if the wiress.. thing?
- huh? I'm telling it to look for networks to join, but it can't see any, it lists none
how do you tell it to look? i had to just type in the name of mine
some of them dont advertise so they wont be found

- in System-Administration-Networking, setup the card to use DHCP (in Properties) then activate the card, then go intoo Properties again, you should have a drop-down list of all the networks in range, but I'm getting none
your wireless AP might be set up to not send that information, mines set up to not 'advertise' it doesnt broadcast anything about itself to people trying to join
thats usually a good idea
- no, there is definitely a network in here it should see. I just gave it the network name myself though, and it's not connecting to it
make sure you give the name, the SSID, and the password info
- there's no such info, it's DHCP connect
its wireless right?
- yes
wireless need name and SSID at least to connect, and usually a password too
WEP password, or WPA preshared key stuff
i think default SSID for most networks is 6
or maybe that was the channel, and ssid was the name of it.. i cant recall
your card shows up the right? a wireless card? when you goto network settings?
- the ESSID is the network name, like "my network", if the network is open, as this one is, that's all you should need. Anyway, the netowrk is advertised, so it shuold see it
- Yeah, I can se the card, but it sees no networks
could you just be too far away?
- I don't think so
hrm im out of ideas then, i know at my house mywireless stuff downstairs had a hard time picking up my access point until i moved it to a place where fewer walls were between us
